moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4 Qe7 3. Nf3 d6 4. dxe5 dxe: Oh no, Pb5 forks the bishop and knight.  Very unpleasant for white.
moves.8... b6: Right piece, just not far enough.
moves.9. h3 Bxf3 10. gxf3: Here white doubles his pawns.  Qxnf3 MIGHT have been better, except black ought to consider Qb4+ and have his pick of QxNa4 or QxBc4.  White could block the check with Nc3, leaving black white's white bishop.
moves.13. Be2 bxa4 14. fxe5 Qxe5 15. Qxa4 Qxe4: ???  Ok, that was a HORRIBLE move.  Granted, white's rook is sitting pretty, with QxRh1+.  But what is stopping QxQe4+?  Black's queen is undefended.
moves.16. f3: Holy s**t this was a horrible move!  NOW what stops QxQa4?  Free queen!
moves.16... Qxe3: ???  Yes, there was a free bishop.  But there was a FREE QUEEN!  This is like stooping to pick up a shiny copper penny when just a few feet away a twenty dollar bill rests.
moves.17. Qxc6+: Ok, that is NOT a free pawn.  I might have considered Qe4+, forcing a queen exchange here.
